alert.note: Alert for Adams; Cumberland; Franklin; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 15 at 7:05PM EST until November 15 at 10:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Wet snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Patches of freezing rain or drizzle are possible. * WHERE...Franklin, Perry, Cumberland and Adams Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The period of heaviest snow will end around 8 PM. Rain and drizzle will be the main precipitation overnight. However, some patches of freezing rain or drizzle are expected until temperatures rise above and stay above freezing overnight.
info.instruction: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts will include snow covered roads and limited visibility. Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway and traffic conditions. To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.
